title: Successful time entry creation
description: Verify that a user can successfully create a time entry with valid task selection, date, duration, activity type, and comments.

steps.description: Open the 'Add Time Entry' modal in the application.
Select a valid task from the hierarchical work items tree.
Input a valid date not in the future.
Set duration using shortcut 1h.
Select a valid activity type.
Optionally add comments.
Click the 'Save' button.
Verify the time entry is saved locally and displayed in the time entries list.
Verify synchronization to Azure DevOps updates CompletedWork and RemainingWork of the selected task.

title: Validation rejects negative duration
description: Verify that the system does not allow entering negative duration values and displays appropriate validation errors.

steps.description: Open the 'Add Time Entry' modal.
Select a valid task.
Input a negative duration value (-1h).
Fill remaining required fields with valid data.
Attempt to save the time entry.
Verify that the system prevents saving and shows an error message indicating negative hours are not allowed.

title: Validation rejects future dates
description: Verify that the system prevents selecting a date in the future when creating a time entry.

steps.description: Open the 'Add Time Entry' modal.
Select a valid task.
Input a date set in the future.
Fill other required fields with valid data.
Attempt to save the time entry.
Verify that saving is prevented and an error message indicates future dates are not allowed.

title: Validation rejects total daily hours exceeding 24
description: Verify that the system disallows time entries that cause the daily total hours to exceed 24 hours for a user.

steps.description: Create time entries summing up to 23 hours for a particular day.
Open the 'Add Time Entry' modal for the same day.
Select a valid task.
Input a duration of 2 hours.
Fill other required fields.
Attempt to save the time entry.
Verify the system prevents saving and shows an error indicating exceeding daily hour limit.

title: Hierarchical Work Items tree expand and collapse
description: Verify that the hierarchical work items tree expands and collapses correctly at various levels (Epic, Feature, User Story, Task/Bug).

steps.description: Open the Work Items tree.
Click to expand the Epic node.
Verify the Features under the Epic are displayed.
Expand a Feature node.
Verify User Stories under the Feature are displayed.
Collapse the Epic node.
Verify all nested nodes disappear.

title: Task Search autocomplete with debounce and pagination
description: Verify that the task search input provides autocomplete suggestions with debounce to minimize API calls, supports pagination, and displays cached results.

steps.description: Focus on the Task Search input field.
Type a partial task ID or title slowly, observing that API calls are not sent on every keystroke due to debounce.
Verify autocomplete suggestions are displayed after debounce delay.
Navigate to next page of results if available.
Verify that paginated results are correctly displayed.
Repeat previous search term.
Verify cached results are displayed without additional API request.

title: Azure DevOps synchronization resilient to API outages
description: Verify that the app continues functioning and preserves local time entry data when the Azure DevOps API is unreachable, and synchronization resumes successfully once API is available again.

steps.description: Simulate Azure DevOps API outage.
Create and save time entries locally.
Verify that entries are saved locally with no application crash or data loss.
Restore Azure DevOps API availability.
Trigger synchronization.
Verify all locally saved entries are synchronized successfully and Azure DevOps work items are updated.

title: Only Task and Bug work items updated in Azure DevOps
description: Verify that CompletedWork and RemainingWork updates in Azure DevOps are only sent for Task and Bug work items, ignoring other types.

steps.description: Select a Task work item and create a time entry.
Select a Bug work item and create a time entry.
Select a Feature or Epic work item and attempt to create a time entry.
Verify synchronization occurs for Task and Bug types but not for Feature or Epic.

title: Weekly Hours Grid displays correct totals and overload indicators
description: Verify that the weekly hours grid correctly sums daily and weekly hours per user, and correctly displays visual overload indicators for days exceeding 8h.

steps.description: Create multiple time entries for various days of the current week.
Open the Weekly Hours Grid view.
Verify daily totals are correct sums of time entries.
Verify weekly total is sum of all days.
Verify days with total hours > 8 show overload visual indicators.

title: Authentication with Azure DevOps Personal Access Token (PAT)
description: Verify that users can authenticate using a valid Azure DevOps PAT and are denied access with invalid or missing token.

steps.description: Launch the app and enter a valid Azure DevOps PAT.
Verify user is authenticated and able to access functionalities.
Log out and relaunch the app.
Enter an invalid PAT.
Verify user is denied access with appropriate error message.
Launch the app without entering PAT.
Verify application prevents access and prompts for authentication.

title: Average time to record a time entry is under 30 seconds
description: Measure the average time taken by a user to open the Add Time Entry modal, fill in required fields, and save a valid entry, ensuring it is under 30 seconds.

steps.description: Record start time.
Open Add Time Entry modal.
Fill task, date, duration, activity type and optional comments.
Click save.
Record end time.
Calculate elapsed time and verify it is less than 30 seconds.

title: Data validation prevents RemainingWork from becoming negative
description: Verify that after synchronization, RemainingWork for any task is never updated to a negative value, even if user tries to log more hours than remaining.

steps.description: Check current RemainingWork value of a selected task.
Create a time entry with duration exceeding RemainingWork.
Save the entry and trigger synchronization.
Verify RemainingWork in Azure DevOps is updated to zero and not negative.

title: Local data caching and offline support
description: Verify the application correctly caches data locally and allows creating and storing time entries offline, synchronizing them automatically once connection is restored.

steps.description: Launch the application with active internet connection.
Create and save some time entries.
Disconnect internet to simulate offline mode.
Create additional time entries.
Verify that new entries are stored locally and visible in the UI.
Reconnect internet.
Verify all pending entries are synchronized with Azure DevOps automatically.

title: UI responsiveness and fast interactions
description: Verify that the application interface loads quickly and user interactions such as opening modal, expanding work item nodes, and searching tasks respond smoothly without lag.

steps.description: Load the main application page.
Verify the UI is fully rendered within 2 seconds.
Open 'Add Time Entry' modal.
Verify the modal opens smoothly within 0.5 seconds.
Expand and collapse hierarchical work items.
Verify nodes expand/collapse smoothly with no visible lag.
Focus task search and type a few characters.
Verify autocomplete suggestions appear promptly with no delay.
